intro: Veronica austriaca subsp. dubia, commonly known as the Austrian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and streambanks.
